intro: Rinorea sinuata, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive zigzagging stems. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape and have a smooth or slightly toothed margin. Rinorea sinuata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique growth form and attractive foliage.
